attributes.comment:
I strongly oppose the proposed USCIS fee increases! The US government fees for
internationally adopting parents are already a significant obstacle to adoption, and
with longer processing for adoptions now occuring, parents are asked to pay
greatly increased fees not just once but twice! Our own government fees should
not be a further obstacle to potential adoptive parents, who face significant costs
already in their attempts to provide a child a home.
I am also dismayed to find the fee for a certificate of citizenship more than
doubling! This same certificate is now given at NO charge to children adopted by
US citizens. But for those whose children entered the country before 2001, the
fee has risen TWICE in the last couple years, and is now rising to $460??? For a
certificate that only reiterates what is already law???
Children and others who are already US citizens should not have to pay nearly
$500 for a certificate proving what the US government already recognizes. I fear
that increasing this fee will cause more people to go without this document at all.

Please reconsider this fee increase. It is a strong potential barrier to adoption,
and to US childrens' ability to prove their rightful citizenship.

Thank-you for your time and consideration,
Leah Moore
adoptive parent
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Leah Moore
